page.title: 09WESTLEIGH QUARRY
page.content: There is only a fairly thin covering of soil over shale rock around here. There have been quarries here for a long time.Many of these have now been left and are covered with brambles and trees,but there are 2 quarries at Westleigh which are still used a lot. We can hear the sound of the huge lorries from our school and every so often we hear them blasting new rock with explosives.The quarry is very busy and although only 18 men work there all the time,many others are employed driving lorries to and from the quarries.This makes the roads around Burlescombe very dangerous. The quarries are slowly using up a hill. However they can dig down a further 40 metres and expect to be working there for many years yet.
